column1: Mul is a town and a municipal council in Chandrapur district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Pincode of Mul is 441224.
Mul is located at 20.09°N 79.67°E﻿ / 20.09; 79.67. It has an average elevation of 198 metres (649 feet).
Places to visit: Somnath is just 9 km away from Mul
column2: well connected via road. Somnath is a well-known tourist place around Chandrapur district. Amtepharm is located in Somnath
column3: which is run by Baba Amthe for leprotic patients.

column1: There is also a ritual place known as markandadeo at about 25 km from mul. There is lord shiva Temple is situated in village at the bank of the Wainganga river
column2: which flows generally from North to South but at Markanda it takes Northward turn for 20 km before again going Southward. It is believed that this uttar vahini (Northward flow) of wainganga river makes this place more sacred to worship lord shiva. A great yatra is heals here on occasion of mahashivratri and thousand of devotees gathers together to worship lord shiva.

column1: Mul is mainly known for rice production
column2: having 53 rice mills covering 90% of rice production in whole Chandrapur district

column1: Rice is supplied throughout Maharashtra involving big cities like Mumbai
The educational facility in Mul was very poor. It found surprising that there is no well-known B.Sc.
column2: M.Sc. college for higher studies. But fortunately
column3: Karmaveer college is offering Bachelore in science since 3 to 4 years. Also
column4: many CBSE schools are offering quality education.

column3: 256. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Mul has an average literacy rate of 67%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 74%
column5: and female literacy is 60%. In Mul
column6: 13% of the population is under 6 years of age. Mul has very big area for MIDC; need to think about development of this area. Power plants are being constructed at MIDC area
column7: near Maregaon. Those who are staying in Mul have struggled for higher studies; there are no colleges for B.Sc.

column1: Mul is connected to the district place Chandrapur by road. The MSRTC buses regularly ply to Chandrapur
column4: Sindewahi. Mul is very well connected via train. Daily DMO runs between Chandrapur and Wadsa via Mul. Now people can enjoy long journey from Mul which connected to Bilaspur and Bangalore via weekly trains.
